intro: Salacia conferta var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved salacia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces yellow-orange berries that are edible but have a bitter taste. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in humid, lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
